channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- Red Hat build of Quarkus 2.13.8.Final
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- Red Hat build of Quarkus 2.13.8.Final

item.title: CVE-2023-2974|2024-08-02T06:41:03.976Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20build%20of%20quarkus%202.13.8.final
item.description: A vulnerability was found in quarkus-core. This vulnerability occurs because the TLS protocol configured with quarkus.http.ssl.protocols is not enforced, and the client can force the selection of the weaker supported TLS protocol.

item.title: CVE-2023-1584|2024-08-02T05:57:23.278Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20build%20of%20quarkus%202.13.8.final
item.description: A flaw was found in Quarkus. Quarkus OIDC can leak both ID and access tokens in the authorization code flow when an insecure HTTP protocol is used, which can allow attackers to access sensitive user data directly from the ID token or by using the access token to access user data from OIDC provider services. Please note that passwords are not stored in access tokens.
